title: jqr introduction
text: jq lightweight flexible command-line JSON processor, written C. ’s super fast, flexible. jq gives ability index , parse, calculations JSON data. can cut filter JSON data. can change JSON key names values. jq lets conditionals comparisons, write custom functions operate JSON data. can convert JSON R list R data structure, proceed data parsing, JSON parsing actual JSON ’s easy enough? ’s jq comes . data manipulations actual JSON makes easy pass data downstream processes expect JSON. already familiar jq using command line can use exact commands jqr. ’ve never used jq, jqr makes jq easy learn domain specific language - can learn actual jq syntax go apply command line outside R.

title: jqr introduction
text: Many functions jqr NSE (non-standard evaluation) well SE (standard evaluation) versions, NSE version sorting array sortj() whereas SE version sortj_(). functions one version, behave SE rules. pass JSON function first parameter (like ad('["","b","c"]')) rather piping (like '["","b","c"]' %>% ad), jq() executed. Rather get back object class jqr holds data passed query. execute query data, run jq(), e.g., like jq(ad('["","b","c"]')) ad('["","b","c"]') %>% jq(). piping JSON DSL functions jq() executed last DSL function used.

title: jqr introduction
text: ’s low high level (DSL [domain specific language]) interfaces jqr.

title: jqr introduction
text: low level high level interfaces unified via function jq(). can access low leve interface using jq() directly, passing JSON string first parameter, program (query) second, flags third (default flags passed). example, JSON string '{"": 7, "b": 4}', program ., resulting program passed exactly ’d pass command line. simple replication command line R, higher level interface, DSL, make easier use jq. Nonetheless, low level interface important jq veterans may want deal DSL, may need drop low level interface DSL doesn’t work reason.

title: jqr introduction
text: jqr DSL uses suite functions construct queries executed internally jq() last piped command. use logic determine whether function call last series pipes, , run jq() JSON string program/query passed. don’t use pipes - optional. Though make things easier can build queries easily, just jq, tools, command line. jq - execute jq peek - peek query, without running string - give back character string combine - combine pieces proper JSON dot - takes input produces unchanged output. dotstr - produces value key ‘foo’ index - index elements, elements name number indexif - , shouldn’t fail found keys - takes input, retrieves keys haskey - checks json string key keys del - deletes provided keys - arbitrary math operations lengthj - length sqrtj - square root floorj - returns floor numeric input minj - minimum element input maxj - maximum element input add - adds strings numbers together map - filter X, run X element input array join - join strings given separator splitj - split string separator argument ltrimstr - remove given prefix string, starts rtrimstr - remove given suffix string, starts startswith - logical output, test input start foo endswith - logical output, test input ends foo indices - array numeric indices foo occurs inputs tojson - dump values JSON fromjson - parse JSON values tostring - convert string tonumber - convert number contains - logical output, determine foo input uniquej - output unique set group - groups elements .foo field separate arrays sortj - sort array reverse - reverse sort array type - select elements type types - get type element funs - Define use functions vars - Define variables use later recurse - Search recursive structure - extract data levels paths - Outputs paths elements input rangej - Produce range numbers - Format strings escaping

title: jqr introduction
text: Peek String Combine
code: '{"a": 7}' %>% do(.a + 1) %>% peek #> <jq query> #>   query: .a + 1 '[8,3,null,6]' %>% sortj %>% peek #> <jq query> #>   query: sort '{"a": 7}' %>% do(.a + 1) %>% string #> [1] "{\"a\": 7}" '[8,3,null,6]' %>% sortj %>% string #> [1] "[8,3,null,6]" x <- '{"foo": 5, "bar": 7}' %>% select(a = .foo) combine(x) #> { #>     "foo": 5, #>     "bar": 7 #> }

Ubuntu 14.04 16.04 lower use libjq-dev Launchpad: recent Debian Ubuntu install libjq-dev directly Universe: Fedora need jq-devel: CentOS / RHEL install jq-devel via EPEL: OS-X use jq Homebrew: Solaris can libjq_dev OpenCSW:
code: install.packages("jqr") sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:cran/jq sudo apt-get update -q sudo apt-get install -y libjq-dev sudo apt-get install -y libjq-dev sudo yum install jq-devel sudo yum install epel-release sudo yum install jq-devel brew install jq pkgadd -d http://get.opencsw.org/now /opt/csw/bin/pkgutil -U /opt/csw/bin/pkgutil -y -i libjq_dev library(jqr)

title: Client for jq, a JSON Processor
text: higher level, uses suite functions construct queries. Queries constucted, excuted internally jq() last piped command. don’t use pipes though. See examples . Examples: Index Sort reverse order Show query used using peek()
code: x <- '[{"message": "hello", "name": "jenn"}, {"message": "world", "name": "beth"}]' x %>% index() #> [ #>     { #>         "message": "hello", #>         "name": "jenn" #>     }, #>     { #>         "message": "world", #>         "name": "beth" #>     } #> ] '[8,3,null,6]' %>% sortj #> [ #>     null, #>     3, #>     6, #>     8 #> ] '[1,2,3,4]' %>% reverse #> [ #>     4, #>     3, #>     2, #>     1 #> ] '[1,2,3,4]' %>% reverse %>% peek #> <jq query> #>   query: reverse

what: get multiple outputs for array w/ > 1 element
title: Client for jq, a JSON Processor
code: x <- '{"user":"jqlang","titles":["JQ Primer", "More JQ"]}' jq(x, '{user, title: .titles[]}') #> [ #>     { #>         "user": "jqlang", #>         "title": "JQ Primer" #>     }, #>     { #>         "user": "jqlang", #>         "title": "More JQ" #>     } #> ] x %>% index() #> [ #>     "jqlang", #>     [ #>         "JQ Primer", #>         "More JQ" #>     ] #> ] x %>% build_object(user, title = `.titles[]`) #> [ #>     { #>         "user": "jqlang", #>         "title": "JQ Primer" #>     }, #>     { #>         "user": "jqlang", #>         "title": "More JQ" #>     } #> ] jq(x, '{user, title: .titles[]}') %>% jsonlite::toJSON() %>% jsonlite::validate() #> [1] TRUE

title: Client for jq, a JSON Processor
text: join ltrimstr rtrimstr startswith endswith tojson, fromjson, tostring contains unique
code: '["a","b,c,d","e"]' %>% join #> "a, b,c,d, e" '["a","b,c,d","e"]' %>% join(`;`) #> "a; b,c,d; e" '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "afoo"]' %>% index() %>% ltrimstr(foo) #> [ #>     "fo", #>     "", #>     "barfoo", #>     "bar", #>     "afoo" #> ] '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "foob"]' %>% index() %>% rtrimstr(foo) #> [ #>     "fo", #>     "", #>     "bar", #>     "foobar", #>     "foob" #> ] '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' %>% index %>% startswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ] '["fo", "foo"] ["barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' %>% index %>% startswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ] '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' %>% index %>% endswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     true, #>     false, #>     false #> ] '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index #> [ #>     1, #>     "foo", #>     [ #>         "foo" #>     ] #> ] '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index %>% tostring #> [ #>     "1", #>     "foo", #>     "[\"foo\"]" #> ] '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index %>% tojson #> [ #>     "1", #>     "\"foo\"", #>     "[\"foo\"]" #> ] '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index %>% tojson %>% fromjson #> [ #>     1, #>     "foo", #>     [ #>         "foo" #>     ] #> ] '"foobar"' %>% contains("bar") #> true '[1,2,5,3,5,3,1,3]' %>% uniquej #> [ #>     1, #>     2, #>     3, #>     5 #> ]

title: Format strings and escaping — at
code: x <- '{"user":"jqlang","titles":["JQ Primer", "More JQ"]}' x %>% at(base64) %>% peek #> <jq query> #>   query: @base64 x %>% at(base64) #> "eyJ1c2VyIjoianFsYW5nIiwidGl0bGVzIjpbIkpRIFByaW1lciIsIk1vcmUgSlEiXX0=" x %>% index() %>% at(base64) #> [ #>     "anFsYW5n", #>     "WyJKUSBQcmltZXIiLCJNb3JlIEpRIl0=" #> ]  y <- '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' y %>% index() %>% at(base64) #> [ #>     "Zm8=", #>     "Zm9v", #>     "YmFyZm9v", #>     "Zm9vYmFy", #>     "YmFyZm9vYg==" #> ]  ## prepare for shell use y %>% index() %>% at(sh) #> [ #>     "'fo'", #>     "'foo'", #>     "'barfoo'", #>     "'foobar'", #>     "'barfoob'" #> ]  ## rendered as csv with double quotes z <- '[1, 2, 3, "a"]' z %>% at(csv) #> "1,2,3,\"a\""  ## rendered as csv with double quotes z %>% index() #> [ #>     1, #>     2, #>     3, #>     "a" #> ] z %>% index() %>% at(text) #> [ #>     "1", #>     "2", #>     "3", #>     "a" #> ]  ## % encode for URI's #### DOESNT WORK --------------------------  ## html escape #### DOESNT WORK --------------------------  ## serialize to json #### DOESNT WORK --------------------------

title: Build arrays and objects — build
code:
## BUILD ARRAYS x <- '{"user":"jqlang", "projects": ["jq", "wikiflow"]}'  jq(x, "[.user, .projects[]]") #> [ #>     "jqlang", #>     "jq", #>     "wikiflow" #> ] x %>% build_array(.user, .projects[]) #> [ #>     "jqlang", #>     "jq", #>     "wikiflow" #> ]  jq('[1, 2, 3]', '[ .[] | . * 2]') #> [ #>     2, #>     4, #>     6 #> ] '[1, 2, 3]' %>% build_array(.[] | . * 2) #> [ #>     2, #>     4, #>     6 #> ]   ## BUILD OBJECTS '{"foo": 5, "bar": 7}' %>% build_object(a = .foo) %>% peek #> <jq query> #>   query: {a: .foo} '{"foo": 5, "bar": 7}' %>% build_object(a = .foo) #> { #>     "a": 5 #> }  # using json dataset, just first element x <- commits %>% index(0) x %>%    build_object(message = .commit.message, name = .commit.committer.name) #> { #>     "message": [ #>         "Add wrapping and clamping to jv_array_slice

Fix #716.  Fix #717." #>     ], #>     "name": [ #>         "Nicolas Williams" #>     ] #> } x %>% build_object(sha = .commit.tree.sha, author = .author.login) #> { #>     "sha": [ #>         "a52a4b412c3ba4bd2e237f37a5f11fd565e74bae" #>     ], #>     "author": [ #>         "tgockel" #>     ] #> }  # using json dataset, all elements x <- index(commits) x %>% build_object(message = .commit.message, name = .commit.committer.name) #> [ #>     { #>         "message": [ #>             "Add wrapping and clamping to jv_array_slice

Fix #716.  Fix #717." #>         ], #>         "name": [ #>             "Nicolas Williams" #>         ] #>     }, #>     { #>         "message": [ #>             "Print offending object in runtime error messages

When reporting an error to the user, add information about the offending
object/value (possibly truncated).

The goal is to give a user some context regarding which input object
caused the runtime error.

Examples:

    $ echo '"hello"' | ./jq '-.'
    jq: error: string ("hello") cannot be negated

    $ echo '"very-long-string"' | ./jq '-.'
    jq: error: string ("very-long-...) cannot be negated

    $ echo '["1",2]' | ./jq '.|join(",")'
    jq: error: string (",") and number (2) cannot be added

    $ echo '["1","2",{"a":{"b":{"c":33}}}]' | ./jq '.|join(",")'
    jq: error: string (",") and object ({"a":{"b":{...) cannot be added

    $ echo '{"a":{"b":{"c":33}}}' | ./jq '.a | @tsv'
    jq: error: object ({"b":{"c":33}}) cannot be tsv-formatted, only array

(Fix #754)" #>         ], #>         "name": [ #>             "Nicolas Williams" #>         ] #>     }, #>     { #>         "message": [ #>             "Fix error message for @tsv" #>         ], #>         "name": [ #>             "Nicolas Williams" #>         ] #>     }, #>     { #>         "message": [ #>             "Don't test input_filename/line_number yet" #>         ], #>         "name": [ #>             "Nicolas Williams" #>         ] #>     }, #>     { #>         "message": [ #>             "Add filename/line functions to jq (fix #753)

This adds `input_filename` and `input_line_number` built-in functions
for use in, for example, `error` messages.

Example:

    $ printf '{"a":1}\n{"a":2}\n' > 4.json
    $ printf '{"a":"hello"}\n' > 5.json
    $ ./jq '{ "file":input_filename, "line":input_line_number, "value":.a }' 4.json 5.json
    {
      "file": "4.json",
      "line": 1,
      "value": 1
    }
    {
      "file": "4.json",
      "line": 2,
      "value": 2
    }
    {
      "file": "5.json",

      "Print offending object in runtime error messages

When reporting an error to the user, add information about the offending
object/value (possibly truncated).

The goal is to give a user some context regarding which input object
caused the runtime error.

Examples:

    $ echo '"hello"' | ./jq '-.'
    jq: error: string ("hello") cannot be negated

    $ echo '"very-long-string"' | ./jq '-.'
    jq: error: string ("very-long-...) cannot be negated

    $ echo '["1",2]' | ./jq '.|join(",")'
    jq: error: string (",") and number (2) cannot be added

    $ echo '["1","2",{"a":{"b":{"c":33}}}]' | ./jq '.|join(",")'
    jq: error: string (",") and object ({"a":{"b":{...) cannot be added

    $ echo '{"a":{"b":{"c":33}}}' | ./jq '.a | @tsv'
    jq: error: object ({"b":{"c":33}}) cannot be tsv-formatted, only array

When reporting an error to the user, add information about the offending
object/value (possibly truncated).

The goal is to give a user some context regarding which input object
caused the runtime error.

Examples:

    $ echo '"hello"' | ./jq '-.'
    jq: error: string ("hello") cannot be negated

    $ echo '"very-long-string"' | ./jq '-.'
    jq: error: string ("very-long-...) cannot be negated

    $ echo '["1",2]' | ./jq '.|join(",")'
    jq: error: string (",") and number (2) cannot be added

    $ echo '["1","2",{"a":{"b":{"c":33}}}]' | ./jq '.|join(",")'
    jq: error: string (",") and object ({"a":{"b":{...) cannot be added

    $ echo '{"a":{"b":{"c":33}}}' | ./jq '.a | @tsv'
    jq: error: object ({"b":{"c":33}}) cannot be tsv-formatted, only array

      "Add filename/line functions to jq (fix #753)

This adds `input_filename` and `input_line_number` built-in functions
for use in, for example, `error` messages.

Example:

    $ printf '{"a":1}\n{"a":2}\n' > 4.json
    $ printf '{"a":"hello"}\n' > 5.json
    $ ./jq '{ "file":input_filename, "line":input_line_number, "value":.a }' 4.json 5.json
    {
      "file": "4.json",
      "line": 1,
      "value": 1
    }
    {
      "file": "4.json",
      "line": 2,
      "value": 2
    }
    {
      "file": "5.json",
      "line": 1,
      "value": "hello"
    }" #>             ], #>             "tree": { #>                 "sha": [ #>                     "e06b0125148eea42b7881c380b6bcfb05c3b102f" #>                 ], #>                 "url": [ #> title: index and related functions — index
code: str <- '[{"name":"JSON", "good":true}, {"name":"XML", "good":false}]' str %>% index #> [ #>     { #>         "name": "JSON", #>         "good": true #>     }, #>     { #>         "name": "XML", #>         "good": false #>     } #> ] '{"name":"JSON", "good":true}' %>% indexif(name) #> "JSON" '{"name":"JSON", "good":true}' %>% indexif(good) #> true '{"name":"JSON", "good":true}' %>% indexif(that) #> null '{"a": 1, "b": 1}' %>% index #> [ #>     1, #>     1 #> ] '[]' %>% index #> [ #>  #> ] '[{"name":"JSON", "good":true}, {"name":"XML", "good":false}]' %>% index(0) #> { #>     "name": "JSON", #>     "good": true #> } '["a","b","c","d","e"]' %>% index(2) #> "c" '["a","b","c","d","e"]' %>% index('2:4') #> [ #>     "c", #>     "d" #> ] '["a","b","c","d","e"]' %>% index('2:5') #> [ #>     "c", #>     "d", #>     "e" #> ] '["a","b","c","d","e"]' %>% index(':3') #> [ #>     "a", #>     "b", #>     "c" #> ] '["a","b","c","d","e"]' %>% index('-2:') #> [ #>     "d", #>     "e" #> ]  str %>% index %>% select(bad = .name) #> [ #>     { #>         "name": "JSON", #>         "good": true #>     }, #>     { #>         "name": "XML", #>         "good": false #>     } #> ]  '[{"name":"JSON", "good":true}, {"name":"XML", "good":false}]' %>%   dotindex(name) #> [ #>     "JSON", #>     "XML" #> ] '[{"name":"JSON", "good":true}, {"name":"XML", "good":false}]' %>%   dotindex(good) #> [ #>     true, #>     false #> ] '[{"name":"JSON", "good":{"foo":5}}, {"name":"XML", "good":{"foo":6}}]' %>%   dotindex(good) #> [ #>     { #>         "foo": 5 #>     }, #>     { #>         "foo": 6 #>     } #> ] '[{"name":"JSON", "good":{"foo":5}}, {"name":"XML", "good":{"foo":6}}]' %>%   dotindex(good.foo) #> [ #>     5, #>     6 #> ]

title: Execute a query with jq — jq
code: '{"a": 7}' %>%  do(.a + 1) #> 8 '[8,3,null,6]' %>% sortj #> [ #>     null, #>     3, #>     6, #>     8 #> ]  x <- '[{"message": "hello", "name": "jenn"},   {"message": "world", "name": "beth"}]' jq(index(x)) #> [ #>     { #>         "message": "hello", #>         "name": "jenn" #>     }, #>     { #>         "message": "world", #>         "name": "beth" #>     } #> ]  jq('{"a": 7, "b": 4}', 'keys') #> [ #>     "a", #>     "b" #> ] jq('[8,3,null,6]', 'sort') #> [ #>     null, #>     3, #>     6, #>     8 #> ]  # many json inputs jq(c("[123, 456]", "[77, 88, 99]", "[41]"), ".[]") #> [ #>     123, #>     456, #>     77, #>     88, #>     99, #>     41 #> ] # Stream from connection tmp <- tempfile() writeLines(c("[123, 456]", "[77, 88, 99]", "[41]"), tmp) jq(file(tmp), ".[]") #> [ #>     123, #>     456, #>     77, #>     88, #>     99, #>     41 #> ]  if (FALSE) { # from a url x <- 'http://jeroen.github.io/data/diamonds.json' jq(url(x), ".[]")  # from a file file <- file.path(tempdir(), "diamonds_nd.json") download.file(x, destfile = file) jq(file(file), ".carat") jq(file(file), "select(.carat > 1.5)") jq(file(file), 'select(.carat > 4 and .cut == "Fair")') }

title: Manipulation operations — manip
code: # join str <- '["a","b,c,d","e"]' jq(str, 'join(", ")') #> "a, b,c,d, e" str %>% join #> "a, b,c,d, e" str %>% join(`;`) #> "a; b,c,d; e" str %>% join(`yep`) #> "ayep b,c,dyep e" ## many JSON inputs '["a","b,c,d","e"] ["a","f,e,f"]' %>% join(`---`) #> [ #>     "a--- b,c,d--- e", #>     "a--- f,e,f" #> ]  # split jq('"a, b,c,d, e"', 'split(", ")') #> [ #>     "a", #>     "b,c,d", #>     "e" #> ]  # ltrimstr jq('["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "afoo"]', '[.[]|ltrimstr("foo")]') #> [ #>     "fo", #>     "", #>     "barfoo", #>     "bar", #>     "afoo" #> ] '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "afoo"]' %>% index() %>% ltrimstr(foo) #> [ #>     "fo", #>     "", #>     "barfoo", #>     "bar", #>     "afoo" #> ]  # rtrimstr jq('["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "foob"]', '[.[]|rtrimstr("foo")]') #> [ #>     "fo", #>     "", #>     "bar", #>     "foobar", #>     "foob" #> ] '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "foob"]' %>% index() %>% rtrimstr(foo) #> [ #>     "fo", #>     "", #>     "bar", #>     "foobar", #>     "foob" #> ]  # startswith str <- '["fo", "foo", "barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' jq(str, '[.[]|startswith("foo")]') #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ] str %>% index %>% startswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ] ## many JSON inputs '["fo", "foo"] ["barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' %>% index %>% startswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ]  # endswith jq(str, '[.[]|endswith("foo")]') #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     true, #>     false, #>     false #> ] str %>% index %>% endswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     true, #>     false, #>     false #> ] str %>% index %>% endswith_("foo") #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     true, #>     false, #>     false #> ] str %>% index %>% endswith(bar) #> [ #>     false, #>     false, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ] str %>% index %>% endswith_("bar") #> [ #>     false, #>     false, #>     false, #>     true, #>     false #> ] ## many JSON inputs '["fo", "foo"] ["barfoo", "foobar", "barfoob"]' %>% index %>% endswith(foo) #> [ #>     false, #>     true, #>     true, #>     false, #>     false #> ]  # get index (location) of a character ## input has to be quoted str <- '"a,b, cd, efg, hijk"' str %>% index_loc(", ") #> 3 str %>% index_loc(",") #> 1 str %>% index_loc("j") #> 16 str %>% rindex_loc(", ") #> 12 str %>% indices(", ") #> [ #>     3, #>     7, #>     12 #> ]  # tojson, fromjson, tostring, tonumber '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index %>% tostring #> [ #>     "1", #>     "foo", #>     "[\"foo\"]" #> ] '[1, "1"]' %>% index %>% tonumber #> [ #>     1, #>     1 #> ] '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index %>% tojson #> [ #>     "1", #>     "\"foo\"", #>     "[\"foo\"]" #> ] '[1, "foo", ["foo"]]' %>% index %>% tojson %>% fromjson #> [ #>     1, #>     "foo", #>     [ #>         "foo" #>     ] #> ]  # contains '"foobar"' %>% contains("bar") #> true '["foobar", "foobaz", "blarp"]' %>% contains(`["baz", "bar"]`) #> true '["foobar", "foobaz", "blarp"]' %>% contains(`["bazzzzz", "bar"]`) #> false str <- '{"foo": 12, "bar":[1,2,{"barp":12, "blip":13}]}' str %>% contains(`{foo: 12, bar: [{barp: 12}]}`) #> true str %>% contains(`{foo: 12, bar: [{barp: 15}]}`) #> false  # unique '[1,2,5,3,5,3,1,3]' %>% uniquej #> [ #>     1, #>     2, #>     3, #>     5 #> ] str <- '[{"foo": 1, "bar": 2}, {"foo": 1, "bar": 3}, {"foo": 4, "bar": 5}]' str %>% uniquej(foo) #> [ #>     { #>         "foo": 1, #>         "bar": 2 #>     }, #>     { #>         "foo": 4, #>         "bar": 5 #>     } #> ] str %>% uniquej_("foo") #> [ #>     { #>         "foo": 1, #>         "bar": 2 #>     }, #>     { #>         "foo": 4, #>         "bar": 5 #>     } #> ] '["chunky", "bacon", "kitten", "cicada", "asparagus"]' %>% uniquej(length) #> [ #>     "bacon", #>     "chunky", #>     "asparagus" #> ]  # group x <- '[{"foo":1, "bar":10}, {"foo":3, "bar":100}, {"foo":1, "bar":1}]' x %>% group(foo) #> [ #>     [ #>         { #>             "foo": 1, #>             "bar": 10 #>         }, #>         { #>             "foo": 1, #>             "bar": 1 #>         } #>     ], #>     [ #>         { #>             "foo": 3, #>             "bar": 100 #>         } #>     ] #> ] x %>% group_("foo") #> [ #>     [ #>         { #>             "foo": 1, #>             "bar": 10 #>         }, #>         { #>             "foo": 1, #>             "bar": 1 #>         } #>     ], #>     [ #>         { #>             "foo": 3, #>             "bar": 100 #>         } #>     ] #> ]

code: # get type information for each element jq('[0, false, [], {}, null, "hello"]', 'map(type)') #> [ #>     "number", #>     "boolean", #>     "array", #>     "object", #>     "null", #>     "string" #> ] '[0, false, [], {}, null, "hello"]' %>% types #> [ #>     "number", #>     "boolean", #>     "array", #>     "object", #>     "null", #>     "string" #> ] '[0, false, [], {}, null, "hello", true, [1,2,3]]' %>% types #> [ #>     "number", #>     "boolean", #>     "array", #>     "object", #>     "null", #>     "string", #>     "boolean", #>     "array" #> ]  # select elements by type jq('[0, false, [], {}, null, "hello"]', '.[] | numbers,booleans') #> [ #>     0, #>     false #> ] '[0, false, [], {}, null, "hello"]' %>% index() %>% type(booleans) #> false
